title: Rocky
description: When world heavyweight boxing champion, Apollo Creed wants to give an unknown fighter a shot at the title as a publicity stunt, his handlers choose palooka Rocky Balboa, an uneducated collector for a Philadelphia loan shark. Rocky teams up with trainer  Mickey Goldmill to make the most of this once in a lifetime break.

reviews.text: What can I say that hasn't been said already? Rocky is a classic. Stallone gives a charismatic performance as the title character, and Carl Weathers is perfectly punchable as the brash and arrogant Apollo Creed.

Rocky took a well-worn story and redefined it by delving deep into the characters. Rocky's character arc is so familiar that everyone, even who don't watch many movies, knows every single detail about it. But the movie adds a simple twist, yet a very effective one, in the character's motivations.But it didn't stop here, as the movie keeps raising the stakes by making an advantage of all the developments that have been given to all the characters.The movie could have easily used the ups and downs of Rocky to evoke our feelings. Instead, the movie succeeded to be very moving by taking advantage of the very new twist that has been added to Balboa's motivations. The result is an underdog heroic character that is by no means clichéd. And Stallone shines in this movie and gave his best performance in his career. There are some moments when Rocky's confidence has been shaken a little bit and the hero starts to tell the message of the story and these moments somewhat worked, and they could have never worked without Sylvester Stallone's superb acting.I said that Rocky takes advantage of the developments of all its characters. Yes, all its characters!The character of Adrian, for instance, has some realistic and genuine details that make the romance between her and Rocky works very well, although the relationship proceeds so fast. Talia Shire performance made Adrian even more realistic,unique and very compelling character.Paulie is another great character that made the movie even more poignant as it gave some depth for Rocky too.What I didn't like so much is Apollo Creed. In contrast to the rest of the characters, he is nothing but the stereotypical undefeated Champion. Also, all decisions he made exposed the movie's clichéd story. With that being said, his scenes are masterfully directed and he has a very catchy style.  The final fight scene is maybe the most realistic fight scene has been shot at that time. And those who think it's not, please watch a boxing match and you'll find that boxing punches make sounds different from the comic book punches sounds that are still used in movies today.(9/10)

One of my favorite movies of all time. It's a true underdog story told very well. The pacing is on point, the writing and characters and how they develop and learn from each other, just the fact that the movie really takes time to make you care for them. The performances of course are amazing and the wit and humor of the characters adds a special charm and lets not forget the fun boxing matches, that when you finally see them are very rewarding and engaging. The punch sound effects are pretty bad and Apollo Creed was a pretty stereotypical opponent however. The motivations of these characters and how they interact is really what made this film special.

The original Rocky movie made in 1976... Rocky is good and it has memorable moments like Talia Shire skating on ice whilst Sylvester Stallone who plays Rocky chats to her... Burt Young makes an appearance and so does Carl Weathers but Rocky even though the original lacks what Rocky II had because it was more enjoyable and fun.. Overall Rocky is a great film but the sequel is better and compared to Rocky II I think Rocky comes off as a lazier, worn out film compared to Rocky II but still a good film but as I said, nowhere near as good as Rocky II.
One of the best boxing movies ever made.The story that is told is nothing new, but it is told extremely well.The final fight scene is a classic
A cinematic classic. A great underdog story of a lower class boxer who wants to conquer a dream. One of my favorites, just perfect.
Rocky is an affecting and rousing classic. Classic montages and well shot boxing scenes, along with a beautiful and raw narrative combine for a excellent sports drama.

Rocky is definitely a cinematic masterpiece and a true underdog story. The movie is perfect in everyway , From absolutely brilliant performances from the whole cast , with a great score and beautiful cinematography. The movie sure hits you in all levels and inspirational to overcome your difficulties.

Mucho tiempo ha pasado y mucha pereza me ha dado ver 'Rocky'. Por fin, me lanzé a verla y la verdad, me gustó. Quizás fuera porque me esperaba TAN POCO de ella que me acabó resultando atractiva.Y es que Rocky, es una buena película que está bien construida y cimentada sobre una base clara, el boxeo.Y a la par, nos muestran el lado más humano del personaje con una trama romántica que funciona perfectamente y hace la película llevadera.El problema de la película viene hacía el final de la misma: antes, durante y después del combate con Apollo. Y es que hay demasiada ternura, junto con el combate que podría haber sido muuuucho más épico... Ah y por cierto, la parte en la que vemos a Rocky trabajando de matón, hay estaba la película ese era el camino.En conclusión, es una buena película, para nada debería ser tan mítica como la gente la ve. Y por supuesto, no hace falta decir que está lejos de 'Toro Salvaje' en todo. Aún así, voy a ser bueno y la voy a dar un 8, más 7 que 8.

Rocky. Seek and do not give up. For me, the film was controversial. It was at the same time interesting in terms of the fact that you should train a lot and then you will get the result, and also really liked the final fight. But at the same time in the movie there were a lot of strange and stupid dialogs in which Rocky looked dumb. Perhaps this was planned.

Tantos años han pasado desde que se consumó este filme, pero el cual sale victorioso ante el tiempo, pues aun con su titulo de clásico setentero, golpea duro como un filme joven. Ciertamente no sabia que esperar, estaba emocionado por finalmente ver esta historia aunque no fuese para nada mi genero, pero me he quedado sorprendido con el hecho de que me haya enamorado de esta, de principio a fin.La historia empieza interesante y termina relacionándote con sus personajes a tal punto que estas esperando con ansias la pelea estelar apostando con emoción. Me he encontrado una parte de mi con rocky, me he enamorado de Adriane y he odiado y respetado a Apollo. Sin duda, he encontrado una pelicula maravillosa y lo que promete ser una gran saga.
10/10*. There were flaws in acting but it's a classic. It inspired many of people. It had big impact! Rocky is definitely a cinematic masterpiece and a true underdog story.

Rocky Balboa (Sylvester Stallone), a small-time boxer from working-class Philadelphia, is arbitrarily chosen to take on the reigning world heavyweight champion, Apollo Creed (Carl Weathers), when the undefeated fighter's scheduled opponent is injured. While training with feisty former bantamweight contender Mickey Goldmill (Burgess Meredith), Rocky tentatively begins a relationship with Adrian (Talia Shire), the wallflower sister of his meat-packer pal Paulie (Burt Young). This story of a down-on-his-luck boxer is thoroughly predictable, but Sylvester Stallone's script and stunning performance in the title role brush aside complaints. I'll give Rocky an A+. (10/10)

don't want one..RockyThere are some dreadful scenes like cutting an eye for clear vision which is not easy to watch but on the other side it has probably one of the best first dates ever portrayed in a movie; the relation between Rocky and Adrian is easily the best thing in here. Rocky is a smart movie; which came off as a surprise to me, the whole movie is a build up to the much awaited fight giving the perfect value and gravitas to the event that it deserved but fails on living up to the expectation for the choreography is way too lose. John seems like an amateur when it comes to execute physical sequences but does a decent job for the rest of it maybe because he probably didn't have to do much since the writing is good enough to sail on its own and Sylvester is amazing on both the roles with a good enough supporting cast. Rocky is the slow ride that is comfortable and in an appropriate tone to its characters and plot giving enough space for the actors and the audience to chew it in.

"Rocky" constrói muito bem seu protagonista, nos cativa e conduz muito bem toda uma trajetória que nos mata de ansiedade no ultimo ato. Os diálogos são bons, as cenas de luta igualmente - mesmo que em vários shot's seja perceptível que o soco não está acertando -, a cena da preparação tão famosa hoje em dia é simplesmente lendária, assim como a OST, e todo o conteúdo moral que o filme aborda - mesmo que levemente; sobre identificação própria e o show que acontece nas lutas deixa o longa ainda mais interessante. not good aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
This is a damn good film, boxing or otherwise, with strong acting, drama and humour. Impressive.

What a complete **** idiot I am for having put off watching this for so long. And what an idiot I am for going in expecting this to just be about a "boxing match." "Rocky," like the other boxing masterworks, is much more than just that. This is a terrifically acted and incredibly sophisticated in terms of narrative. It's a welcomed surprise when most of the best bits in a boxing movie are just scenes of two characters talking. This also ages supremely well as far as movies of this era are concerned. Again -- leaving this out of my life for so long? Big mistake. Long live the champ.

Classic movie. The character part about Rocky is perfect and Stallone shows a great performance. Also the story about him is top.But the 2 shown fights are so unrealistic. So I cant give a 10, even though the movie is based upon a real fight (Muhamad Ali fought against an underdog and it went to the distance, Ali fell on the ground also)

There is a 75 character minimum for reviews. If your review contains spoilers, please check the Spoiler box. Please do not use ALL CAPS. There is no linking or other HTML allowed. Your review may be edited for content.

It is the quintessential underdog movie and started a legacy. Even people that have never seen the movie know who Rocky is. Every day many people still run up the “Rocky Stairs” at the Museum of Art in Philadelphia and raise their arms like Rocky did in the movie. It is the charm of this underdog story with relatable characters and great pictures. For the story: Heavyweight champion Apollo Creed played by Carl Weathers can not fight for the title because his challenger injured his hand. Because it is too late to get a new professional challenger they decided to give an amateur the once in lifetime chance to fight for the championship. Because of Rocky's nickname “The Italian Stallion” he is picked by Apollo Creed without even caring. It is Sylvester Stallone's best role as he plays the relatable and sympathetic everyman that has a hard life and struggles. There is the heartwarming lovestory between him and Adrianna Pennino played by Talia Shire. There is the struggle with his trainer Mickey Goldmill played by Burgess Meredith that knows Rocky's potential but also says that he wasted it. Finally it is Rocky's iron hard training as he will do everything to use his chance and trains like never before that wins many over. The final fight is as dramatic as intense as Apollo Creed expected an easy opponent and thought he would win before he even get sweaty. He gets someone who is filled to the brim with willpower and determination. The ending is pure bittersweet awesome. All things mentioned above create an unforgettable experience. The Rocky series is still strong and entered pop culture history long ago. It is the blueprint for underdog stories that always touch something inside of us. Overall this is an all time classic and rightfully so. A must see even if you don't like boxing. Bonus knowledge: There is a real live fight that inspired this movie. Muhammad Ali fought against Chuck Wepner whose nickname was “The Bayonne Bleeder” in 1975. Everyone expected a fast knockout but Chuck gave the performance of his live and even knocked down Ali. The fight got even to round 15 when Ali won. Sylvester Stallone saw this fight and was impressed by this man. The rest is history as he wrote the script to Rocky.
Though I have to admit that this movie didn't blow me away, I can say that Rocky is a great movie with a heartwarming underdog story at the center of it.

The movie that put Stallone in the spotlight and beyond. The story of how an unnamed street fighter came close to reaching the top has no expiration date. Although it takes time to arrive, the training and combat sequences are equally exhilarating. A classic from the 70s.
Classic Underdog StoryWith a talented lead, A unpredictable story, And plenty of emotion. Rocky is a timeless classic that will never get old.
I liked Rocky, but I feel like there were a lot of scenes and character moments that seem to come and go out of nowhere.
"Rocky" was a Beautiful,amazing and funny movie! Rocky himself came from a dimwitted Philadelphian to a Ultimate Boxer star!

Amazing experience!the whole movie it was calm,nostalgic and satisfying with slow build-up at start with up's and down's of daily life and little conflicts with others and there amazing build-up of relations with the brilliant and extreme use of opportunity ended with dramatic and amazing fight it was pure phenomenal experience!the music was brilliant specially the theme song it was amazing,the acting was iconic every character and there relations with Rocky was amazingly developed the Couples starting dates and all were slow and little awkward  although there love and relationship was amazing,the story was simple and great with amazing screenplay,the little things in society was amazingly captured specially with the side characters like the 12 year girl and people around bar and all,the starting intro was amazing and the vibes were nostalgic it was amazing,the daily life struggles of fighter were greatly showcased with the boxing back-down of trainer and later he's conversation was emotional,the opportunity from creed was literally amazing the people's change and there real thing for rocky was satisfying,the training scene was beautiful and amazing the scenery was beautiful and then the whole last act it was pure mind-blowing the awesome use of opportunity and that extreme fight with dramatic end it was chillingly satisfying and amazing end,the whole movie is chilling calm and awesome with dramatic struggles and amazing build-up of relations with awesome end it was beautiful,satisfying and amazing movie its a Masterpiece!

Yes this is a classic film, perhaps even a cult classic and yes there are undeniably some cliches present but I found myself rooting for Rocky and I liked seeing his relationship with the introverted Adrian develop. Of course there's the famous scenes of him pounding the streets in the very early morning, practicing day after day in the build up to the match which happens at the end of the film. I could see how this could be viewed as a 'living the American dream' type watch, or perhaps moreso an 'underdog' tale. Its quite a solid watch. Given im not a particular fan of sports, especially boxing, I wasn't expecting a great deal of this but I reckon I enjoyed it more than I perhaps imagined I might because the majority of the film isn't set in the ring, as it were and instead it concentrated on Rocky's life outside the ring, his clearly low-ish standing and it shows how he did what he could to try and raise himself above that.It is a bit cheesy but for the most part, its a reasonably solid watch and I respect that. Yes, I'd recommend this to others.

I **** love everything about this movie, I love the story, I adore the characters, I love the dialogue throughout this movie, I love the montage in this one, I enjoy the funny scenes and finally, I love the fight scenes throughout this movie. Overall, it's a great **** movie, one of my honest favourites, it's honestly worth the watch.
The best movie of all time in my opinion. Straight masterpiece. I have nothing more to say.

Rocky ... how legendary this movie is. The beginning of Sylvester Stallon's stellar career just started here and it's no wonder. The movie is great. Now I don't even think it's a boxing match, but I mean that the film is just motivating to practice, which is only good. I don't have much to add. Great movie you just should see. This is a classic.

7.5/10Rocky wasn't a boxing film that you will expect as the movie mostly follow Rocky's undergrounds life, preparing, and the most notably his love story with Adrian, so don't expect to be a back and forth boxing sequence here and there, Rocky was for me not one of the best thing ever, and in terms of a sports movie i can see why it's iconic but i'm pretty sure if i watch the film when it was release i will not gonna be so amazed by it, mostly by the cheesy acting by Rocky himself, Sylvester Stallone, i feel like he's was just not acting except when he scream Adriaannn!!!, anyway, he wasn't all the way through bad, there is still a good scene with him, but mostly it's cheesy entertaining, and the rest of the cast was pretty good, and for the rest of the film, Rocky is a pretty good while also cheesy sports film that are very entertaining and enjoyable to watch and i still like it.
A classic! The story of Rocky Balboa and Stallone himself are awe inspiring!

Much like the titular boxer, the film suffers from a lumbering pace combined with an all-around predictable plot/outcome. However, with that being said, this film has a heart, soul, and passion thanks to its moments of vulnerability, character bonding, environment establishment, and music montages. Special highlights I must acknowledge go to Burgess Meredith delivering a brilliant performance and Sylvester Stallone's solo writing contribution to the entire film....and yes, he is the one and only Rocky Balboa.
It's not a boxing movie, it's a love story with boxing as the backdrop. Rocky and Adrian for life
The first half was very meandering and slow, and the payoffs are not nearly as high or entertaining as they need to be. Every scene with Carl  Weathers was awesome.

The slogan for this movie is "His whole life was a million to one shot," and that this movie got made at all was a million to one shot too. Out of those extremely long odds came this masterpiece of a movie that is extremely well acted and powerfully uplifting. We feel for Stallone's Rocky all the way through, and that is what makes this movie excellent to watch to this day.
I don't know how I could give this movie anything less than 10-stars. This movie is perfect and Stallone is at the top of his game in this film.

Rocky es una película clásica del cine y bien merecido lo tiene, nos habla sobre como debemos esforzarnos al máximo para lograr muestras metas, y esta película convirtio a Stallone en un actor de Hollywood y a Rocky Balboa en un símbolo de lucha y esperanza
